node.title: Chef José Andrés makes emotional plea as he helps feed Ukrainian refugees
node.description: "We didn't learn enough from the horrors of the past," he said.
node.content: ["Chef Jos\u00e9 Andr\u00e9s made an emotional plea to the world as he helped feed Ukrainian refugees at the Polish border, saying \"we need to speak up against leaders breaking us apart.\"\u00a0", "Andr\u00e9s shared a selfie-style video late Monday calling attention to the plight of Ukrainian people escaping violence in the country. He said \"it's hard to know\" that Ukrainian refugees \u2014 mainly women with children \u2014 are outside in freezing temperatures or in their cars without gas waiting in line to leave the country.\u00a0", "\"Why do we put young men and women in this situation?\" he said. \"We didn't learn enough from the horrors of the past.\"", "We are all Ukrainians right now \ud83c\uddfa\ud83c\udde6 It\u2019s been a long day\u2026but before I go to sleep here\u2019s my message to you\u2026 #ChefsForUkraine pic.twitter.com/cumv3NwfUF", "Andr\u00e9s also took aim at Russian President Vladimir Putin, who called for the invasion into Ukraine. \"People, we need to speak up against leaders that are breaking us apart...\" he said. \"Life is not a Monopoly game. Life is real. And the voiceless and the poor are always facing the consequences.\"\u00a0", "At least 677,000 people have fled Ukraine since the invasion began, and many more are expected to leave,\u00a0according to\u00a0the U.N. refugee agency.\u00a0", "The renowned chef's charity, World Central Kitchen, said it is now in Ukraine, Romania and Poland helping to\u00a0feed hungry people who have been displaced. In a Tuesday update, Andr\u00e9s filmed himself at a local bakery outside Lviv, Ukraine, where he helped provide flour to a bakery in need.\u00a0", "\"People need to be fed,\" he said. \"And sometimes in a bakery like this, you see people are helpful with the bread.\"\u00a0", "Checking in from outside Lviv in Ukraine! I\u2019m at this amazing bakery that is working with @WCKitchen to feed refugees fleeing Ukraine & also the community still here\u2026They are baking so much we are going to bring them more flour. Take a look at the operation! #ChefsForUkraine \ud83c\uddfa\ud83c\udde6 pic.twitter.com/ZlRT56jSyu", "The U.N. and humanitarian agencies have launched\u00a0an emergency appeal\u00a0to raise $1.7 billion, citing a \"steep rise in humanitarian needs as essential supplies and services are disrupted and civilians flee the fighting.\" The U.N. estimates that 12 million Ukrainians will need protection and relief.\u00a0", "Christopher Brito is a social media producer and trending writer for CBS News, focusing on sports and stories that involve issues of race and culture."]
